Considerable cloudiness PERIOD Low 41F PERIOD Winds light and variable PERIOD

Updated November     pm



The African American Cultural Centeris putting on a Kwanzaa celebrationSaturday in the Ohio Room of the HadleyUnion Building at  p.m PERIOD for anyoneto come celebrate the holiday beforebreak PERIOD

Kwanzaa is an annual holiday thatnormally is celebrated at the end of December PERIOD

However Indiana University ofPennsylvania has been celebrating thisfestive occasion about family communityand culture for the past couple ofyears before the fall semester ends PERIOD

Dr PERIOD Carolyn Princes who is the directorof the AACC talked about boththe theme of the event and the purposebehind it PERIOD

Kwanzaa is about inspiring and motivatingand uplifting people Princessaid PERIOD It gives them for hope for thefuture PERIOD We want to give them somethingthey look forward to and givethem drive Princes added PERIOD We wantto bring people together and give theminspiration for finals as well. this is a free event and open to everyone PERIOD

There will be several activities forguests to enjoy such as guest speakerDr PERIOD Sarah Gatumu PERIOD

She is a psychiatrist from the IndianaRegional Medical Center PERIOD Gatumuwill be giving a speech centered on theevents theme which she summed up inone sentence

When you aim for the sun youmight land on the moon and when youaim for nothing you will hit nothing everytime Gatumu said PERIOD

In addition to her lecture there willbe musical and dance performances forguests from the Ewabo Caribbean BandHead Rocs the Rapper Faith TempleChildrens Choir and the African DanceEnsemble PERIOD

There will also be childrens eventsbecause it is open to people of all ages PERIOD

There will be the opportunity forchildren to make ethnic and holidaythemed

crafts PERIOD

The event will have free food availableto guests and is also asking thatthose in attendance bring some type ofdish to share with others PERIOD In addition tothis the AACC is encouraging attendeesto participate in the charity drivewith donations PERIOD

They are seeking donations of nonperishablefoods andor cold weatherclothing such as gloves scarves hatsand socks PERIOD

These donations will go to a localfood bank and the Salvation Army respectively PERIOD
